title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 50.1 - Findings of fact
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 50.1 - Findings of fact

State Regulations

The board finds that certain industries, trades, occupations and processes involving the use or presence of lasers involve
elements of potential danger to the lives, health and safety of persons
employed therein. The board finds, therefore, that special regulations are
necessary for the protection of such persons in that lasers emit infrared, visible or ultraviolent coherent light which may have the property of producing
deleterious effects upon the human body and within the human eye and in that
other hazards associated with lasers may be present. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
50.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
